clinical_study.brief_title: TREATMENT WITH ANTI-SARS-COV-2 IMMUNOGLOBULIN IN PATIENTS WITH COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: TREATMENT WITH ANTI-SARS-COV-2 IMMUNOGLOBULIN IN PATIENTS WITH COVID-19: A PHASE I / II STUDY

lead_sponsor.agency: D'Or Institute for Research and Education

clinical_study.source: D'Or Institute for Research and Education

brief_summary.textblock: A Phase I/II clinical trial for safety and efficacy evaluation of treatment with anti-SARS-CoV-2 equine immunoglobulin (F(ab')2) in hospitalized patients with COVID-19 not requiring of invasive ventilation support.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of adverse events related to the infusion of anti-SARS-CoV-2 immunoglobulin through CTCAE v4.0.
Clearence of viral RNA evaluated by RT-PCR

secondary_outcome.measure: Reduction of viral load evaluated by area under the curve of RT-PCR values
secondary_outcome.description: Viral load reduction evaluated by area under the curve of RT-PCR values

secondary_outcome.time_frame: For as long as the duration of the hospital stay
secondary_outcome.description: number of days between admission and discharge
Number of patients who progressed to the use of invasive mechanical ventilation and require orotracheal intubation throughout hospitalization
number of patients who experienced adverse events after the immunoglobulin infusion
Frequency of adverse events classified following CTCAE
Results of a 7-point ordinal severity scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Modulation of serum and cellular inflammatory marker
secondary_outcome.description: Exploratory analysis of the variation of inflammatory markers by ELISA/Luminex and flow cytometry, compared to baseline levels
